definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Cylindrical little light more set off the sentiment that Luo Mandi overcomes.
sentences.chinese: 圆柱形小灯更映衬了罗曼蒂克的情调。
我是个罗曼蒂克的人，经常为汽车写诗。

sentences.english: and you want it to be romantic.
sentences.chinese: 你想要那天成为罗曼蒂克的一天。

sentences.english: While Venus retrogrades , there is always the possibility of a miscommunication or error in judgment regarding romance.
sentences.chinese: 金星的逆行，总会伴随这对罗曼蒂克错误判断。

sentences.english: It is considered to be one of the most romantic photos to have ever been taken.
sentences.chinese: 这是公认的最罗曼蒂克的照片之一。

sentences.english: Romantic love songs fill the air in that cozy Italian restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 那家温馨的意大利餐馆充满着罗曼蒂克的情歌。

sentences.english: The item, as retailed, is romantic in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 据说，这件新闻是非常罗曼蒂克的。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
petit bourgeois/yuppie/abbr. of 小資產階級|小资产阶级
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
